concept.title: Usage guide
concept.shortdesc: With Beermat up and running, usage is fairly simple, this section outlines usage of the main editor, the graphical editor.

section.title: Graphical Editor (SVG Editor)
section.p: This is the main editor, showing a large centred canvas, surrounded by toolbars.
The top toolbar are element properties, changing these will change how elements are drawn on the canvas. To see full functionality of this toolbar refer to
The left vertical toolbar are the different tools available, see
The toolbar located on the bottom relate to the canvas, this includes zooming, and showing a grid, as well as mouse position. See

section.title: Clicking the Canvas
section.p:
Left click is used for drawing, selecting and moving elements, see
for a full explanation of how selection works in beermat can be

Right clicking will bring up the popup menu, more options become enabled when right clicking with elements selected, see
for a detailed right click description.

section.title: Panning the Canvas
section.p: Depending on the size of the SVG document, or if the document is currently zoomed, scroll bars will appear to allow the user to pan the SVG. The scroll wheel on the mouse can also be used to pan the SVG image. The SVG can also be panned by using the mouse with the scroll bars.

section.title: Shortcuts and tricks
section.p: Once a shape has been created on the canvas, to create another of the same size, just click on the canvas where you want it located and an identical shape will appear.
With an element selected, using the arrow keys will nudge the element by 1 pixel in that direction, this is useful for fine-aligning an element
With an element selected, either backspace or delete will work to delete an element off the canvas.
